The game immersed to me to the point it no longer felt like a game;I felt like the apocalypse would occur had I not...

snippet.textDisplay:
Yeah, though I don't let that stop me from enjoying those stories.

This may seem random, but I have actually been trying to write a time travel story that makes sense, so I've gotten to the point where I notice all sorts of paradoxes in those stories.

Here's another marvelous example: Buzz Buzz went back in time to stop Giygas from unleashing devastation upon the future, but that means the future was saved, giving Buzz Buzz no reason to go back and tell Ness the story. =D
snippet.textOriginal:
Yeah, though I don't let that stop me from enjoying those stories.

This may seem random, but I have actually been trying to write a time travel story that makes sense, so I've gotten to the point where I notice all sorts of paradoxes in those stories.

Here's another marvelous example: Buzz Buzz went back in time to stop Giygas from unleashing devastation upon the future, but that means the future was saved, giving Buzz Buzz no reason to go back and tell Ness the story. =D

snippet.textDisplay:
Well, I've never heard of Porky being a "king in all times." I suppose him going to points in time that took place before his birth is a question of whether or not Porky's position in the timeline has an effect on his body's aging process, which it clearly does.

On the other hand, I LOVE time travel, and always have. :D Definitely my favorite science fiction plot device.
snippet.textOriginal:

On the other hand, I LOVE time travel, and always have. :D Definitely my favorite science fiction plot device.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well, that's still a paradox... if they killed Giygas as a fetus, then that would mean Giygas pretty much never existed at all (also meaning that Mother 1 didn't happen) and never became an enemy of Ness and friends, thus meaning they didn't kill him and he IS alive, in turn meaning they DID kill him. So, the theory about EarthBound's final battle being an abortion is nonsense.

Also, how is Porky in Mother 3 a time paradox?

Just because Pokey manipulated and envied Ness doesn't mean he hated him. Pokey just fell to the Mani Mani statue's powers because of his self centered thoughts. If you notice, he follows the statue up until it breaks, (Onett > Happy Happy Village > Fourside) and then he began to use Giygas's power to continue down the road he already started on.

Giygas turned him evil, and in turn Pokey used him to get the power he always wanted.

If you pay attention to the seemingly useless babble Pokey spews right after phase 1 of the final battle, he states that Giygas had gained so much power, he destroyed his mind and physical being. This is why he is not aware of who he is, where he is, and what he's doing.

The game never really tells you how far back in time you are sent when you get into the Phase Distorter. Logically, it would have to be sometime AFTER Mother ended, since Giygas has his mind and body in Mother.

snippet.textDisplay:
**SPOILERS AHOY**

It's simple, really. Giygas's physical form was completely and utterly destroyed. All that was left was his spirit; an entity of complete and total evil. This is pretty much why you can only beat him by using Pray (also Brainshock to try and hinder his ability to hurt the party).

Long story short, you're fighting Giygas's ghost.
snippet.textOriginal:
